subject: Re: [junit] test for super()
msgSnippet: Kamal, I can t think of a possible way to test something, or a motivation for trying, if removing it would result in the same behavior.  Can you explain
messageBody:
Kamal,

I can't think of a possible way to test something, or a motivation for
trying, if removing it would result in the same behavior. Can you
explain further?

David Saff

Kamal Ahmed wrote:
> Hi,
>
>
>
> Is there a junit test for :
>
>
>
> The super() has reference to the following method
>
> public
>
> void activateOptions() {
>
> }
>
>
>
>
>
> Source, to be tested:
>
>
>
> public void activateOptions() {
>
> super.activateOptions();
>
> }
>
>
>
>
>
> Test Method :
>
>
>
> public void testactivateOptions() {
>
>
>
> }
>
>
>
>
>
> Do we even test methods that do not do anything, other than call parent ,
> and the parent also does not do anything.
>
> Thanks,
>
> -Kamal.
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>
